channel.title: Need Help With Forms - A bit advanced?
channel.description:
Okay, im makin a script that is going to be pretty complex but extremely user-friendly.
Anyways, im going to have one form that constantly stays up beside the RS window. It will have several labeled buttons on it. Now, i want it to be so that when you click one of the buttons on the main form, it will take you to another specified form(im gonna end up having like 9 different forms....).
So, how do i make it switch to another form when you click a button, and then i need to make it go back to the original form when you click a button ( i will have a back button in the bottom left).
Here is a straight forward explanation
1- Main Menu Form 2- Click Button 'A' on main menu form 3- Form 'A' pops up 4- Click 'Back' Button on Form 'A' which takes you back to main menu form
:D

item.title: Need Help With Forms - A bit advanced?
item.dc:creator: @solemn_wishes solemn wishes
item.description:
@solemn_wishes wrote:

this action will be quite simple if approcahed correctly, if you take a look over starblasters free powerminer you will see that he includes something simular to what you are looking for.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help With Forms - A bit advanced?

item.title: Need Help With Forms - A bit advanced?
item.dc:creator: @omgh4x0rz omgh4x0rz
item.description:
@omgh4x0rz wrote:

I think what you do is set up two forms, Form A and Form B. Then in your buttonclick procedure for Form A, initialize Form B procedure. That way, when you click that button on A, it should bring up B.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help With Forms - A bit advanced?

So, how do i make it switch to another form when you click a button, and then i need to make it go back to the original form when you click a button ( i will have a back button in the bottom left).

Here is a straight forward explanation

1- Main Menu Form
2- Click Button ‘A’ on main menu form
3- Form ‘A’ pops up
4- Click ‘Back’ Button on Form ‘A’ which takes you back to main menu form
